messages.text:
Hello, I'm Isaac, and I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task. 

When you're using the "Ask <question> with a numeric answer. Save the answer in <numeric variable>" block, you need to select a numeric variable to store the answer. If you have already defined a numeric variable in your program, you should see it in the dropdown list. If not, you need to create a new numeric variable.

To create a new numeric variable, you can go to the "Variable" category and select the "Number" block. After you've created the variable, you can go back to the "Ask <question> with a numeric answer. Save the answer in <numeric variable>" block and select the variable you just created from the dropdown list.

Remember to click the "Apply" button at the top center of the programming environment to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution. 

Let me know if you need further assistance!

Hello, I'm Isaac. I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task.

Regarding your question, when you tap on "save answer in ____" in the "Ask <question> with a numeric answer" block, you should select a numeric variable where you want to store the answer. If you haven't created a numeric variable yet, you can do so by going to the Variable category and selecting the "number" option. After creating the variable, you can then select it in the "save answer in ____" field. This will allow the program to store the user's numeric input in that variable for later use in your program. 

Remember to always hit the Apply button to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution. Let me know if you have any other questions!

Hello, I'm Isaac. I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task.

When you're using the "Ask <question> with a numeric answer. Save the answer in <numeric variable>" block, you need to select a numeric variable where the answer to your question will be stored. If you have already defined a numeric variable for this purpose, you should select it. If not, you need to create a new numeric variable.

To create a new numeric variable, you can go to the Data interface by clicking on the Data button on the top-right corner of the programming environment. There, you can create a new numeric variable by clicking on the "Add Numeric Variable" button. After creating the new variable, you can go back to your block and select the new variable in the "save answer in ____" field.

Remember to click on the Apply button to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution. Let me know if you need further assistance.
